intro: Mesembryanthemum caspicum, commonly known as the Caspian ice plant, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, pink, and white, typically blooming in the morning. Its thick, fleshy leaves store water, allowing it to thrive in dry, sandy environments. Mesembryanthemum caspicum is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
